attributes.action: Don’t allow a hasty poll to negate the UK’s democratically expressed opinion.
attributes.additional_details:
We therefore assert that it is both undemocratic and irresponsible for parliament to advise the UK to leave the EU now, especially with no known execution plans.
Please see:
1)	Professor AC Grayling’s article at http://nowweknow.co.uk/why-parliament-has-a-duty-to-keep-us-in-the-eu/
2)	The comments during the limited (by subject matter) debate of 05 September 2016 Hansard Volume 614 at https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2016-09-05/debates/1609058000001/EUReferendumRules#debate-134846
attributes.background: At the last General Election 3 out of 4 MPs who were democratically elected by the UK were known to want the UK to remain in the EU. The hasty EU referendum campaign was dominated by immigration and was also dishonest. Had 1 person in 50 who voted leave voted remain the result would have been a tie.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
